column4: Hi ... wouldn'it be nice, if xchat joins automatically #ubuntu (or in my case #ubuntu-de :P) on startup (I mean, without any configuration, after installing ubuntu like in opensuse)?
pidgin has an autojoin option, maybe xchat does too
you misunderstood me
http://xchat.org/faq/#q23
i said: you missunderstood me
then wassup?
my concern was, that xchat should automatically join #ubuntu after a fresh installation of ubuntu without any configuration
not everybody will want that
assuming what a user will want to connect to is very rude imho
it would be easier for beginners
it could be an install time option maybe
not really, madriva is pretty user friendly
and suse is nice for beginners too
ubuntu want to be for beginners
i disagree but its offtopic here
which font

23:18:50 < dAnjou> hey, i am approved member of the ubuntu font family interest group on launchpad and want to test the monospaced font here on lucid but i can't find it after installing ubuntu-private-fonts.
its documented on omgubuntu
well i did, what they say, but it doesn't work. i don't have the font. (keep in mind, i have 10.04 here)
You can apply to become a beta tester by  joining the Ubuntu Typeface Interest group on Launchpad and waiting to be approved/granted access to the PPA. I'd contact the devs
did you actually read my question??
then contact the devs, they are the ones restricting access
AND use natty
as you say
